intro: Racosperma leptospermoides subsp. obovatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wattled grevillea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its slender, obovate leaves and bright red or orange flowers that appear in dense, clustered inflorescences. The plant thrives in sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions with a Mediterranean climate. It is a member of the Proteaceae family, known for its showy floral displays and ecological importance to native pollinators. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation areas.
